PTD R&D Engineer Intel Corporation February 2011  –  March 2014  (3 years 2 months) Portland, Oregon 1. Worked on Intel's 22nm and 14nm process technology development.  
2. Developed test methodology, test hardware and software for nanoscale process characterization.

Graduate Researcher UC Riverside September 2006  –  January 2011  (4 years 5 months) Riverside, california 1. Research and development in the area of theory, modeling, and simulation of nanoscale electronic and photonic devices and circuits. 
2. Experience in developing custom (10K lines of codes) solid-state device modeling tool. Software projects/applications predicted device performance, provided validation/characterization of advanced nano-electronic devices (carbon/Si 1D/III-V, II-VI nanowire (NW)/Hybrid systems). 
3. Developed several models based on semiclassical and quantum mechanical formalism to investigate performance and performance limits of semiconductor electronic and optoelectronic devices in nanometer scale. Models able to calculate electronic structures, charge density, spin density and investigate effects of scattering due to surface roughness, phonons, edge states, surface states, impurities, etc on the performance of devices based on Carbon, III-V and II-VI, Si materials – for both MOSFETs and tunneling FETs (TFETs). 
4. Three years R&D experience in theory, modeling, simulating, and analyzing semiconductor electronic and optoelectronic devices in nanometer scale. 
5. Published one book chapter and more than 20 peer reviewed journal and conference papers. 
6. Presented research results in more than 20 peer reviewed conferences and seminars. Device Engineer, Internship Intel September 2009  –  January 2010  (5 months) Sep 8, 2009 ­ Jan 1, 2010 
· Worked extensively with device test equipments such as Semiconductor parameter analyzer, 
Logic analyzer, switching matrix, Pulser, Scopes, probe station equipments. Defined 
characterization strategy, test flows, and implemented them by coding to understand specific 
device issues, which will be implemented through electrical device testing, fed back into process 
development. 
· Invented a novel technique for ultra-low power operation of PCM devices. Experience Product Development Engineer Intel Corporation October 2013  – Present (1 year 11 months) Santa Clara, California Area Product Development Engineer Intel Corporation September 2012  –  October 2013  (1 year 2 months) Austin, Texas Area • Drove the power characterization on ATE platform for Intel ATOM SoC 3rd microprocessor to success. 
• Lead the development and enabling of the Power Binning for the latest Intel SoC microprocessor. 
• Identify critical yield limiters and integrated with cross functional teams to root cause failures.  
• Perform electrical characterization and statistical data analysis to assess product performance.

Product Developement Engineer Advanced Micro Devices October 2009  –  August 2012  (2 years 11 months) Austin, Texas Area • Created & executed Validation test plans for Fuses. Generated and integrated test content for for ATE Test.  
• Verified test patterns and ran simulations on virtual test environment for pre-silicon verification. 
• Perform electrical characterization and statistical data analysis to assess CPU product performance. 
• Work with cross-functional teams to perform Si Debug to root cause failures & implement robust product design fixes to enhance performance of CPU, GPU.  
• Led the pre-production qualification for 28nm and 32nm test chips. Coordinated design of ATE Credence Sapphire test hardware, Device Interface Board and substrate/package design.  
• Conduct experiments and DOEs for Flip Chip/C4 bumping, back end of line (BEOL), interconnect process technology development. 
• Integrate with foundry to assess Chip to Package Interaction issues, Cu-Ultra Low K readiness, Product manufacturability, quality and reliability. 
• Support development of FEOL, BEOL wafer fabrication process technology. 
• Incorporated a tool to forecast & manage samples which saves AMD over $1Million annually. 
• Developed an optimized process to assist capacity planning for cross-organizational project execution and budget forecasting. Technology Transfer Intern Arizona Technology Enterprises June 2009  –  October 2009  (5 months) Phoenix, Arizona Area • Evaluated invention disclosures from physical sciences professors/engineering staff at Arizona State University.

Process Technology Implementation/ Product Development Co-op engineer Advanced Micro Devices May 2008  –  December 2008  (8 months) Austin, Texas Area As a Co-op Engineer my goal was to dive deep into the key areas of semiconductor design & manufacturing, perform experiements on the various steps involved from manufacturing of silicon to assembling microprocessors to Various levels of testing, debug, process change targeting, to delivering CPUs to the customer. 
 
• Developed front-end process improvement solutions for leading edge process technologies for 45nm and 65nm Server, Desktop and laptop x86 microprocessors

• Identified and validated process sensitivities to enable solutions for Yield enhancement & process node development for speed and power improvement.

• Actively supported manufacturing of heavy duty induction motors.
